messages.subject: psycho librarians ...
messages.msgSnippet: haha, I ll have to remember that statement *IN THE BOX*!!! well, here z an update on my h-s ing friend who decided to challenge the library s policy on WHAT
messages.messageBody:
haha, I'll have to remember that statement *IN THE BOX*!!!

well, here'z an update on my h-s'ing friend who decided to challenge the
library's policy on WHAT constituted TEACHING MATERIALS after my horrible
experience earlier this week ... well, @ least I'm NOT crazy b/c the same
thing happened to her only this time, the head lib was FLAILING (my friend's
words) her arms around and raising her voice in a very condescending manner
saying, "WHAT IS IT W/ YOU H-S P~E~O~P~L~E YOU ARE *ALWAYS* TRYING TO GET
TAKE ADVANTAGE AND GET AROUND THE SYSTEM!!!" welllllllllllll, we've decided
to take the matter up w/ the higher~ups b/c this lady obviously has it in
for h-s'rs ... even though, the other day she PROMISED to address this
matter in their staff meeting Monday morning (HA) ... either that or she was
pulling a Dr. Jeckle/Mrs. Hyde routine on my h-s friend b/c she was very
cooperative w/ me ... we're also decided it's time to get our local h-s
support group leadership involved, so, I'll keep ya'll posted (yes, I have a
heavy southern drawl) ...
Pris


----- Original Message -----
From: B & T Simpson <michigan@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 10, 2000 10:16 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Redwall series???


>
> I'm In ! I took my kids to the library a few weeks back and gave my
daughter
> my teachers card to check out her mandi books on ( 5th grade chapter
books )
> the librarian told her she would have to check them out on her personal
card
> because the teacher card was only for teaching items???? I said uh hello
we
> homeschool, as far as we are concerned everything they read is a teaching
> item! duh some people are just so how shall we say IN THE BOX! I am so
> glad to be out of it!!!!
> Tanya
> >
> >Redwall and Kipling aren't appropriate? What is that person smoking?
> >
> >Lynda, who hopes you find the head librarian and serve the other one's
head
> >to them on a platter!
>
